page.title: 13LARTINGTON HALL
page.content: had no son the house was left to his nephew, Henry Lawson of Brough. Henry was also the heir to the Brough estates so Lartington and Hardwick was passed to his sister Catherine Lawson who, in 1772 married John Silvertop of Ministeracres and became Caterine Silvertop Maire. Catherine had 5 children and her second oldest son Henry changed his name to Witham. Henry married at 23 to Eliza Williams of Headlam, Henry became known as Harry Witham. Harry was a compulsive gamblerand lost a lot of his wealth, but he became famous through his love of geology. Henry lived at Lartington and in 1823 his mother sold the Hardwick estates to get him out of financial problems. When Witham left Lartington he lived in Edinborogh and studied
